intro: Psychotria minuta, commonly known as the little psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Psychotria minuta is also known for its potential medicinal properties and has been studied for its alkaloid content.
